titleStmt.title: A new prognostication for the year of our Lord God, 1675 Being the third after bissextile or leap-year, and from the creation of the world, 5634. Wherein is contained the exact day, hour and minut of the new moon, her full and quarters; with the descriptions, and calculations of the visible eclipses; the daily disposition of the weather, and moveable feast; with the whole known fairs in Scotland. Exactly calculated according to art, for the meridian of the most famous city of Edinburgh. Whose latitude is deg. 56 min. 04. longitude is 21. 50. By I. C. mathematician.
titleStmt.author: I. C.

notesStmt.note: Identified on film as Wing A1386D ("no entry" in Wing 2nd,ed., 1994).
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
